Did you check the simple stuff, like is the subclass setter really
setting the superclass variable?  I'd try changing the superclass
variable to private and see if you get a compile error.

Kevin
--- billy.bacon@... wrote:
> I'm having an issue when accessing a member variable
> that exists in my super class from my subclass. I have
> an accessor method called getUserSession() which is
> being called from my AssetManagerTestCase class (which
> extends CMSTestCase). The getUserSession() method is
> defined in CMSTestCase. 
> 
> The setUserSession() method is called within my setUp()
> method within CMSTestCase. So the object is being set
> properly when the setUp() method is called but once my
> textXXXX() methods start to be executed in my subclass,
> the object is null.
> 
> Does anyone know why I'm losing the value of this
> object when my textXXXX() methods are executed.
> 
> Thank you in advance.
> 
> - Bacon -
> 
>
